etymologies: late 16th century: from French tragacante, via Latin from Greek tragakantha ‘goat's thorn’, from tragos ‘goat’ (because it is browsed by goats) + akantha ‘thorn’ (referring to the shrub's spines)

definitions: a white or reddish plant gum, used in the food, textile, and pharmaceutical industries.

notes.text: This gum is obtained from plants of the genus Astragalus, family Leguminosae, in particular the Eurasian A. gummifer

shortDefinitions: white or reddish plant gum, used in food, textile, and pharmaceutical industries
